website_summaries.verdict: This high-end tamper is factory calibrated to deliver the right pressure, and clicks to let you know when you've hit the mark.
pros: of pressure, the recommended force for great espresso
No need for calibration or adjustment
Subtle click releases at the proper pressure
Stainless steel base, anodized aluminum handle
cons: Ensures proper tamping pressure, which espresso experts may have already achieved

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased 3 of these tamps and as I do like them and their consistency they seem to be extremely fragile and will quit clicking. Out of the 3 that we purchased they have all quit clicking. We have a foam mat in our shop and when a barista accidentally drops on of these tamps they always quit clicking. In a perfect world a barista would never drop a tamp but as it is bound to happen I feel like these tamps are too fragile and expensive for the coffee shop environment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Update: Clicker stopped working!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: The "click" stopped working after a few regular uses. This is extremely disappointing because for over $100, I now have a regular tamper. I do not recommend now and the company should correct this with their customers.
customer_reviews.author: JBSerious

customer_reviews.title: Precision tampering
customer_reviews.text: Great unit once you lubricate the shaft with food quality silicone lubricant. The spring movement was anything but smooth when this unit arrived, so if you purchase one, plan to lubricate it. Once lubricated, it is the ticket for consistent tamping pressure for someone who only makes a few coffees a day. I'm now forever spoiled. All I have to do now is tweak my grind a bit and it's perfect shots every time.
customer_reviews.author: Harry J Stuivenga

customer_reviews.title: Quality tamper, helps with consistency of tamping.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Measured 27lb force on my bathroom scale (which isn't the most accurate in the world - but it's in the ballpark). The magnitude of the tamping force isn't as critical as the repeatability. Works well on a Silvia double basket (though at low doses, eg. 12g, the basket shoulder prevents the tamper from fully tamping). Most importantly, it helps a beginner with consistency when applying the tamping force. One less variable to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Thng

product_meta.title: ESPRO Calibrated Stainless Steel Convex Espresso Coffee Tamper, 58 mm, Black
product_meta.description: Size:58 mmSometimes Things Just Click. Our company began with a search for perfection and a desire to eliminate unknown variables from the brewing process, which led us to develop the ESPRO Calibrated Tamper, our very first product and patent. The Tamper replaces guesswork with precision by delivering an exact 30 pounds of force with a reassuring click every time. Water will always seek the path of least resistance. ESPRO’s Calibrated Tamper ensures that all the grounds are compressed uniformly and consistently, creating perfectly even resistance against water pressure and ensuring full saturation. By eliminating variations in tamping force, we’ve made it possible to ensure consistent espresso from barista to barista, hour to hour, day to day, with only the need for a simple grinder adjustment. We designed the tamper with a stainless steel base and an anodized aluminum handle for durability, and it’s available in a variety of sizes with both flat and convex bases.
feature_bullets: CONSISTENT ESPRESSO, EVERY TIME - Consistently great espresso needs a constant 30 pounds of tamping force. The ESPRO Calibrated Tamper brings this consistency day in, day out
FACTORY CALIBRATED - Does not require recalibration or adjustment
PERFECT BALANCE - Just like the perfect espresso, the perfectly balanced ESPRO Calibrated Tamper just feels right in your hand
A CLICK YOU FEEL - The click is a subtle click that you feel rather than hear - it won’t disturb the grinds and cause channeling
SUBSTANTIAL - A solid tool for baristas, with a stainless-steel base and an anodized aluminum handle
FIVE CONVEX BASE OPTIONS - please check your espresso machine basket size - 49 mm, 51 mm, 53 mm, 57 mm, 58 mm (good for espresso baskets with slightly curved bottoms)
